intro: Pseudomorus pendulina var. australiana, commonly known as the Australian hanging bell, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its pendulous, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
